plants.name: Camellia japonica
plants.description: An evergreen shrub native to eastern Asia, valued for its large, glossy leaves and beautiful rose-like flowers that brighten winter gardens.
plants.location: East Asia, cultivated worldwide in mild climates
plants.funFact: Camellias are shade-tolerant and often bloom when few other plants do, making them treasured for winter color.

plants.name: Helleborus niger
plants.description: A hardy perennial native to the Alps that produces delicate, white to pink cup-shaped flowers often blooming through winter snow.
plants.funFact: Despite its common name, the Christmas Rose is not a rose but a member of the buttercup family.

plants.name: Erica carnea
plants.description: A low-growing evergreen shrub native to the mountains of Europe, this species produces abundant bell-shaped flowers that offer color during cold months.
plants.funFact: Winter heath can tolerate very cold temperatures and is often used as ground cover to provide winter interest in gardens.

plants.name: Acacia dealbata
plants.description: A fast-growing evergreen tree native to southeastern Australia featuring fluffy, fragrant, bright yellow flowers in dense clusters.
plants.location: Australia, widely cultivated in Mediterranean climates
plants.funFact: Mimosa's bright yellow blooms are an iconic sign of late summer in Australia and are celebrated on International Women's Day in some countries.
